Jim:

Very helpful! Kiyotsugu, that is the artist. When did he work?
(I need to pay more attention to your resources page, Jim. I noticed 
the book was listed there)

Thanks very much!
Ron
ps Bob R, do you have this book? If so, how much is it? (please email 
me privately)

--- In nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com, "Jim Gilbert" <jggilbert@E...> 
wrote:
> Ron,
> For sideline Goto the best book I'm aware of is "Studies in Kyo 
Goto" (Kyo
> Goto no Kenkyu) by Koju Kasahara and Shigeo Akimoto, 1988.  It is 
in English
> and Japanese.  The Seijo family chart shows one student of Seijo 
Masafuku
> (the 5th) and his name is Enomoto Kiyotsugu.  He later changed his 
name to
> Kiyohisa.  There are some other students of other generations 
listed too.
> 
> Jim
> 
> 
> > Gentlemen:
> >
> > I have a set of koshirae that appears to have been made by a 
student
> > of Goto Seijo (5th). The student is not listed in the Kinko 
Meikan.
> > (info from the Murtha fittings volume)
> >
> > Is there any English language resource on the Goto artisans that
> > would list genealogies, students etc. ?
> > What is the best Japanese language resource on this kinko school?
> >
> > Thanks!
> > Ron P.
> >
